questionText: On April 22, 1993 five young white men stabbed Stephen Lawrence.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Lawrence was an 18 year old black youth.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Lawrence was stabbed at a bus stop in London.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Police provided Lawrence no first aid.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Lawrence bled to death.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Police treated Lawrence's grieving parents badly.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: The case collapsed before trial.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: In 1996 Stephen's parents initiated a civil suit.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: In Feb 1999, a government report found London's police force 'riven with pernicious and institutionalized racism'.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: A play about Stephen Lawrence's 1993 murder is called Color of Justice.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: Stephens Lawrence was murdered on April 22, 1993.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Lawrence was murdered while he waited at a bus stop.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Lawrence was murdered by a gang of white males.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Three members of the gang were charged with murder.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: The Color of Justice" was a popular play about the incident."
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Laws were put into place making racial discrimination an offense.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: A scholarship for minority students in memory of Lawrence was started.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: After this incident, racism in the police department was brought to light.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: The racially-motivated murder was committed by a gang of white males.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: London police were slow to act in trying to save Lawrence's life.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Eventually police charged three members of the gang for murder.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Their investigation was so flawed that the state prosecution had to abandon the case.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Stephen's parents publicly pursued justice for their son.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Stephen's parents brought two suspects to civil court.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Racism in the police department was exposed.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Stephen Lawrence was stabbed to death at a London bus stop in April 1993.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Lawrence was the son of Jamaican immigrant parents.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: He was attacked by five white youths with a history of race baiting.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Three of the alleged killers were tried and acquitted.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Charges against the other two were dropped for insufficient evidence.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: London's Metropolitan Police were found to be 'riven with pernicious and institutionalized racism'.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Public confidence in the police had fallen.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: The Labor government of Tony Blair promised a radical overhaul of race discrimination laws.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: One fifth of London's population are minorities.
author: A3GQ6KDIZWCMW6

questionText: 94% of British citizens are white.
author: A3GQ6KDIZWCMW6

questionText: An architecture scholarship was launched by Prince Charles to honor Lawrence's memory.
author: A3GQ6KDIZWCMW6

questionText: Of Lawrence's five assailants, three were acquitted.
author: A3GQ6KDIZWCMW6

questionText: Stephen Lawrence was attacked in April 1993 at a London bus stop.
author: A3GQ6KDIZWCMW6

questionText: Stephen Lawrence was 18 years old and the child of Jamaican immigrants.
author: A3GQ6KDIZWCMW6

questionText: Just over 2% of London's police force are minorities.
author: A3GQ6KDIZWCMW6

questionText: Athena was the name of a the crackdown on racist crimes in London.
author: A3GQ6KDIZWCMW6

questionText: Three of five suspects in the killing were questioned and released.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: None of the suspects were brought to trial.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Lawrence's parents filed a civil lawsuit against the suspects.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Three suspects were acquitted in the civil suit.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: On April 22, 1993, Stephen Lawrence was stabbed to death at a London bus stop.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Stephen Lawrence was an eighteen-year-old black youth.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Lawrence was stabbed to death by a group of white attackers.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: His killing became the focus of debate over relations between police and ethnic minorities.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Police acted slowly and incompetently investigating his murder.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Five years after his killing, the Metropolitan Police Commissioner apologized to the teen's parents.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Seven years after the killing, three of the five suspected killers were arrested for the murder.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7
